sentences: Ta oli nädal aega ilma kõrvadeta.
Lapsed märkasid ära hääl läbi kõrvade.
context: The word 'kõrvad' is the plural form of the Estonian word 'kõrv', which means 'ear'. In Estonian, words ending in '-d' typically indicate the plural form. So 'kõrvad' specifically refers to ears (more than one ear). This word is commonly used when talking about body parts, hearing abilities, or physical characteristics of people and animals.
